info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 14 at 7:37PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint ID ...The Forest Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint ID has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch... * WHAT...The avalanche danger may rise to High on Tuesday. * WHERE...For the Cabinet, Selkirk and Purcell Mountains of Northwest Montana. * WHEN...In effect until 7 PM MDT Tuesday * IMPACTS...Heavy snowfall and wind will likely create widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions may develop, making travel on and below steep slopes inadvisable. Consider avoiding all avalanche terrain. Avalanches could be large and may run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of any Avalanche Center. &&
